goals.description: Reduce sediment yields by 77-97% within the Broken Pumpkin Creek watershed to reflect stable conditions.
goals.schedule: Through incremental funding cycles within the project period.
goals.sourceExcerpt: The sediment TMDL ... concluded yields would need to be reduced by 77-97% within the watersheds in order to reflect stable conditions.

implementation.description: Develop, execute, and implement a Subgrant Agreement that specifies roles, tasks, requirements, and milestones for project implementation.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Work to develop, execute, and implement a Subgrant Agreement that specifies the roles, tasks, requirements, and milestones for project implementation. (Month 1)

implementation.description: Facilitate meetings, media, and social media promotion of the project; coordinate activities to fully implement the plan.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Facilitate, in coordination with MDEQ and other partners, meetings, media and social media promotion of the project, and coordinate activities to fully implement this plan. (Months 1-36)

implementation.description: Inform landowners and operators within the watershed about the project and secure commitments from priority area landowners and operators willing to participate.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Work with the Tallahatchie County SWCD, MSWCC, NRCS, and MDEQ to inform landowners and operators within the watershed about the project and work to secure commitments from priority area landowners and operators who are willing to participate in the project. (Months 1-6)

implementation.description: Determine priority areas within the sub-watershed contributing significant pollutant loads using GIS applications and intensive site surveys.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Work with the local SWCD, MSWCC, NRCS, and MDEQ to determine through GIS applications and intensive site surveys the priority areas within the sub-watershed that are contributing significant pollutant loads. (Months 1-36)

implementation.description: Install all BMPs in accordance with NRCS Technical Field Manual or other approved guidelines.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: All BMPs shall be installed in accordance with the guidelines developed in the latest edition of the NRCS Technical Field Manual, or other approved guidelines. (Months 1-36)

implementation.description: Complete and implement a baseline water quality monitoring plan and track changes in water quality over time resulting from implemented BMPs.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Facilitate, in cooperation with MDEQ and other monitoring partners, the completion and implementation of an effective and efficient plan to monitor baseline water quality conditions in the watershed and track changes in water quality over time resulting from the BMPs implemented through this project. (Plan Completion:  Months 1-2); Implementation:  Months 3-36)

implementation.description: Submit blank copies of standard maintenance agreements to MDEQ.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Submit blank copies of standard maintenance agreements to MDEQ. (Months 13-36)

implementation.description: Conduct inspections of BMPs during construction.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Conduct inspections of BMPs during construction (Months 3-36)

implementation.description: Collect GPS coordinates of all installed BMPs and incorporate into GIS format according to Federal Geographic Data Committee standards.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Coordinate with and support the local SWCD, MSWCC and NRCS in the collection of relevant GPS coordinates of all installed BMPs and incorporate this information into a GIS format. All geospatial data shall be collected in a manner consistent with the Federal Geographic Data committee-endorsed standards. (Months 3-36)

implementation.description: Collect adequate photo documentation before, during, and after installation of approved BMPs.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Collect adequate photo documentation before, during, and after installation of the approved BMPs (Months 3-36)

implementation.description: Report measured or estimated nonpoint source pollutant load reduction, acreage affected, pre- and post-site conditions, and GIS data.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Report measured, or estimated, nonpoint source pollutant load reduction, acreage affected, pre-and post- site conditions, and GIS data (1-36)

implementation.description: Target priority areas for BMPs in coordination with project partners.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Coordinate with the MDEQ, NRCS, MSWCC, USGS, and the Noxubee and Lowndes Co. Soil and Water Districts to determine priority areas that are contributing significant pollutant loads to Broken Pumpkin Creek Watershed. (Months 1-2)

implementation.description: Establish Watershed Implementation Team (WIT) to begin refinement of the watershed-based plan.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Establish Watershed Implementation Team to begin refinement of Watershed Based Plan for Broken Pumpkin Creek Watershed. (Months 1-2)

implementation.description: Initiate baseline condition monitoring using historical data.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Initiate watershed monitoring  Baseline condition monitoring Completed using historical data

implementation.description: Meet with landowners and cooperators to secure commitments to install BMPs in priority areas.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Meet with landowners and cooperators to secure commitments to install BMPs in priority areas. (Months 1-6)

implementation.description: Establish routine meeting schedule for WIT to support watershed plan revision.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Establish routine meeting schedule for WIT to support WBP revision. (Months 1-36)

implementation.description: Implement BMPs in the watershed.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Implement BMPs BMP installation (Months 6-36)

implementation.description: Inspect BMPs installed using Section 319 funds.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Coordinate with Landowners to inspect BMPs that were installed using Section 319 funds (Months 3-36)

implementation.description: Begin monitoring to collect data on post-BMP water quality.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Begin monitoring to collect data on post BMP water quality (Months 42-48)

implementation.description: Finalize education and outreach plan and schedule events.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Finalize education and outreach plan Education/Outreach events scheduled (Months 8-36)

monitoring.parameter: M-BISQ (Mississippi Benthic Index of Stream Quality)

thresholds.parameter: M-BISQ (Mississippi Benthic Index of Stream Quality)

outreach.description: Water Model Presentations (Enviroscapes and groundwater aquifer models) distributed statewide with training and lesson plans
Train educators near the watershed about nonpoint source (NPS) pollution and provide materials for classroom use
Adopt A Stream workshops and training for citizens, teachers, and students in the Dry Creek Watershed
Watershed Harmony Mobile Classroom for ages kindergarten–adults, tailored for 4th and 5th grade students
Workshops and materials for Soil and Water Conservation Districts and Extension Service
Broken Pumpkin Creek Watershed Implementation Team (WIT) face-to-face meetings to provide updates, review, and modify the plan
Host field days to showcase implemented BMPs to the public
Education events including training workshops, festival event planning, soil and water conservation field days, poster/art/writing projects
Provide food, refreshments, and facility support for stakeholder meetings and outreach events as allowed under Section 319
Use evaluation forms, pre-test/post-test, surveys, and attendance reporting to measure outreach success
outreach.indicator: number of people attending workshops, trainings, events

Lowndes County Soil and Water Conservation District
